required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Efficacy and Safety Study of Desloratadine (MK-4117) in Japanese Participants With Eczema/Dermatitis and Dermal Pruritus (MK-4117-202)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicenter, Open-Label Long-Term Trial to Study the Efficacy and Safety of MK-4117 in Japanese Subjects With Eczema/Dermatitis and Dermal Pruritus.

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

brief_summary.textblock: This is a efficacy and safety study of up to 12 weeks of desolatadine in Japanese participants with eczema/dermatitis and dermal pruritus.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in pruritus/itch score (sum of daytime and nighttime scores) assessed by investigator at Week 2
Percentage of participants who experienced at least one adverse event
Percentage of participants who discontinued from study drug due to an adverse event

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in pruritus/itch score (sum of daytime and nighttime scores) assessed by investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 3, Week 1, Week 4, Week 6, Week 8, and Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with improvement in the Global Improvement Rate assessed by investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 3, Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 6, Week 8, and Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the degree of pruritus recorded by participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 3, Week 1, Week 2, Week 4, Week 6, Week 8, and Week 12

arm_group.description: Desloratadine, 5 mg, orally, once daily, one 5-mg tablet in the evening for up to 12 weeks. After Week 4, the dose of desloratadine can be increased from 5 mg/day up to 10 mg/day (two 5 mg tablets in the evening), if criteria for dose up-titration are met and there is insufficient anti-pruritic efficacy and no safety concern

intervention.description: Desloratadine, 5 mg, orally, once daily, one 5-mg tablet in the evening for up to 12 weeks (Desloratadine, 10 mg/day, orally, once daily, two 5-mg tablets in the evening for up to 8 weeks)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eczema/dermatitis (acute eczema, chronic eczema, contact dermatitis, atopic dermatitis, nummular eczema, seborrheic dermatitis, asteatotic eczema, neurodermatitis, etc. among eczema/dermatitis for which the observation of pruritus is appropriate)
- Dermal pruritus (generalized dermal pruritus, localized dermal pruritus)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypersensitivity to antihistamines or ingredients of a study drug
